page.title: 09PUBLIC HOUSING
page.content: East Brighton has a substantial amount of public housing of varying age and character. Lying within a valley of its own overlooked by the racecourse, the Whitehawk estate has grown into a large almost separate community. Begun in the 1930's the early housing was drab and unimaginative but much has now been redeveloped to provide interlocking terraced dwellings with small gardens & connecting paths which contribute to a much brighter and more pleasant environment. Closer to the town centre areas of older terraced housing have been completely removed and replaced by a mixture of modern high rise flats, two and three storey maisonettes and terraced houses. In conjunction with the tightly packed older terraced dwellings of Kemp Town they contribute to the very high local population densities.
